subject: Politics
title: The Green Economy
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Green Economy usable.

hook.text: The green economy is a $5 trillion opportunity. But fossil fuel industries are fighting to slow the transition.

buildup.text: Transitioning to clean energy creates new industries, jobs, and investment. It's also a massive political fight.

discovery.text: Solar and wind are now cheaper than coal in most places. The economics favor transition; politics resists it.

twist.text: Oil companies knew about climate change in the 1980s and funded denial campaigns. Profits came before the planet.

climax.text: The green transition creates losers: coal miners, oil towns, and petrostates. Managing their decline is political.

punchline.text: Green energy is economically smart. Making it happen is politically hard.

quiz.question: Why is the green energy transition politically difficult?
